      • areEqual

        public static boolean areEqual(double x,
                               double y)
        Determine if two floating point values are essentially the same (uses epsilon = 1.0e-11)
        Returns:
        true if x == y within 1e-11, false otherwise

      • areEqual

        public static boolean areEqual(double x,
                               double y,
                               double epsilon)
        Determines if two floating-point values are equal within the given epsilon. 
            Numbr.areEqual(0.0, 0.0, 0.0)                      = true
    Numbr.areEqual(1, 2, 1)                            = true
    Numbr.areEqual(123.4567891, 123.4567892, 0.000001) = true
    Numbr.areEqual(123.456789, 123.456790, 0.000001)   = true
    Numbr.areEqual(-8.765, -8.764, 0.0011)             = true
    Numbr.areEqual(1, 3, 1)                            = false
    Numbr.areEqual(123.456789, 123.456790, 0.0000001)  = false
    Numbr.areEqual(-8.765, -8.764, 0.001)              = false
        Parameters:
        x - value1
        y - value2
        epsilon - the delta to use to compare if x is essentially equal to y
        Returns:
        true if x is within epsilon of y

      • isEven

        public static boolean isEven(long value)
        Determines if the passed-in value is even or not. 
            Numbr.isEven(7) = false
    Numbr.isEven(8) = true
        Returns:
        (@ code true } if the passed value is even, { @ code false } otherwise

    Numbr.isOdd(8) = false
        Returns:
        (@ code true } if the passed value is odd, { @ code false } otherwise

      • isWithinRange

        public static boolean isWithinRange(long value,
                                    long minimum,
                                    long maximum)
        Determines if the given value is within the given minimum and maximum. 
            Numbr.isWithinRange(20, 15, 25) = true
    Numbr.isWithinRange(20, 5, 15)  = false
    Numbr.isWithinRange(20, 25, 35) = false
        Returns:
        true if value is inclusively between the minimum and maximum

      • isWithinRange

                                    double minimum,

    Numbr.isWithinRange(20.0, 25.0, 35.0) = false
        Returns:

                                   long minimum,

    Numbr.isOutOfRange(20, 5, 15)  = true
    Numbr.isOutOfRange(20, 25, 35) = true
        Returns:
        true if value is not between the minimum and maximum

      • limitValue

        public static int limitValue(int value,
                             int minimum,
                             int maximum)
        Limits the passed value between the minimum and maximum indicated. 
            Numbr.limitValue(237, 100, 200) = 200
    Numbr.limitValue(237, 200, 300) = 237
    Numbr.limitValue(237, 300, 400) = 300
        Parameters:
        value - the value to limit
        minimum - the minimum number to return
        maximum - the maximum number to return
        Returns:
        the result of limiting value to no less than the minimum and no more than the maximum

      • round

        public static long round(long value,
                         long precision)
        Round the given value to the nearest multiple of precision. 
            Numbr.round(17387, 0)    =     0
    Numbr.round(17387, 1)    = 17387
    Numbr.round(17387, 2)    = 17388
    Numbr.round(17387, 10)   = 17390
    Numbr.round(17387, 100)  = 17400
    Numbr.round(17387, 500)  = 17500
    Numbr.round(17387, 1000) = 17000
    Numbr.round(-1689, 10)   = -1690

      • round

        public static double round(double value,
                           double precision)
        Round the given value to the nearest multiple of precision. 
            Numbr.round(58.915, 0.0001) =  58.915
    Numbr.round(58.915, 0.001)  =  58.915
    Numbr.round(58.915, 0.01)   =  58.92
    Numbr.round(58.915, 0.1)    =  58.9
    Numbr.round(58.915, 1.0)    =  59.0
    Numbr.round(58.915, 10.0)   =  60.0
    Numbr.round(58.915, 100.0)  = 100.0
    Numbr.round(58.915, 1000.0) =   0.0
    Numbr.round(-58.915, 0.01)  = -58.92
    Numbr.round(-58.915, 1.0)  =  -59.0

      • min

        public static double min(double... values)
        Determines the minimum of an array of values. 
            Numbr.min(double[] darray)
    Numbr.min(1.2, 3.4, 5.6)
        Parameters:
        values - one or more values passed in as either an array or comma-delimited parameters
        Returns:
        the minimum value found in the given array, or zero if no values passed

        Returns:
        [0] = mean, [1] = stddev
